settings.setupServer.distrosDescription: We strongly recommend to use the following distros to ensure the best experience:

settings.securityAudit.ubuntuDebianSuppo: Ubuntu/Debian OS support is currently supported (Experimental)
settings.securityAudit.ufwDescription: UFW (Uncomplicated Firewall) is a simple firewall that can be used to block incoming and outgoing traffic from your server.
settings.securityAudit.notInstalledUfw: Not Installed (UFW should be installed for security)
settings.securityAudit.notActiveUfw: Not Active (UFW should be enabled for security)
settings.securityAudit.defaultShouldBeDe: Default: {value} (Should be set to 'deny' for security)
settings.securityAudit.sshDescription: SSH (Secure Shell) is a protocol that allows you to securely connect to a server and execute commands on it.
settings.securityAudit.notEnabledKeyAuth: Not Enabled (Key Authentication should be enabled)
settings.securityAudit.enabledShouldBeDi: Enabled (Should be disabled when using key-based auth)
settings.securityAudit.fail2banDescripti: Fail2Ban (Fail2Ban) is a service that can be used to prevent brute force attacks on your server.
settings.securityAudit.notInstalledFail2: Not Installed (Fail2Ban should be installed for protection against brute force attacks)
settings.securityAudit.notEnabledFail2ba: Not Enabled (Fail2Ban service should be enabled)
settings.securityAudit.notActiveFail2ban: Not Active (Fail2Ban service should be running)
settings.securityAudit.notEnabledSshProt: Not Enabled (SSH protection should be enabled to prevent brute force attacks)
settings.securityAudit.modeNotSet: Mode: {value} (Aggressive mode recommended for better protection)
